question: Which of the following was the objective of the Morley-Minto Reforms?
option2: Abolish the post-of Secretary of State for India
option4: Give more powers to local government
explanation: The Indian Councils Act 1909 or Morley-Minto Reforms or Minto-Morley Reforms was passed by British Parliament in 1909 in an attempt for the extension of Provincial Assemblies and to widen the scope of legislative councils, placate the demands of moderates in Indian National Congress and to increase the participation of Indians the governance.
